alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; De Kalb; Putnam; Van Buren; White (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 11:19PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cumberland, southeastern De Kalb, northeastern Van Buren, White and southeastern Putnam Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1118 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms centered near Sparta, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cookeville, Crossville, Sparta, Spencer, Fairfield Glade, Monterey, Crab Orchard, Pleasant Hill, Doyle, Hamptons Crossroads, Cumberland Mountain State Park, Bakers Crossroads, Virgin Falls State Natural Area, Lake Tansi, Indian Rock Lake and Fall Creek Falls State Park. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 290 and 340. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Brief heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to minor localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cumberland; De Kalb; Putnam; Van Buren; White
